VIEW-MASTER (The White House)
VIEW-MASTER: THE WHITE HOUSE Official Residence of United States Presidents - Reel One
(1) South Front from the Lawn Fountain
(2) East Room is largest in White House
(3) Green Room reflects style of 1800
(4) Blue Room holds funiture dating from Monroe
(5) Pier Table made in 1817
(6) Minerva Clock adorns mantle in Blue Room
(7) Blue Room View. Memorials to 2 great leaders
VIEW-MASTER: THE WHITE HOUSE Official Residence of United States Presidents - Reel Two
(8) Red Room d�cor is that of 1830 formal parlor
(9) French Desk in Red Room
(10) State Dining Room can seat more than 100 guests
(11) Cross Hall connects famous formal rooms
(12) "Family" Dining Room now serves state functions
(13) Entrance Hall with Blure Room in background
(14) Library style re-creates early 19th century
VIEW-MASTER: THE WHITE HOUSE Official Residence of United States Presidents - Reel Three
(15) China Room has items from each First Lady
(16) Diplomatic Reception Room
(17) This Bedroom was Lincoln's Cabinet Room
(18) Treaty Room, where historic decisions are made
(19) Cabinet Room in West Wing
(20) Office of the President of the United States
(21) President's desk and couch area
